docs.lead_paragraph: Vaccination prices have risen significantly over the past 30 years, creating dilemmas for physicians and parents and straining public health budgets.

headline.main: The Price of Prevention: Vaccine Costs Are Soaring
headline.print_headline: The Price of Prevention: Vaccine Costs Soaring

docs.abstract: Vaccination prices have gone from single digits to sometimes triple digits in the last two decades; situation is creating dilemmas for doctors and their patients as well as straining public health budgets; childhood immunizations are so vital to public health that Affordable Care Act mandates their coverage at no out-of-pocket cost; once a loss leader for manufacturers, vaccines now can be very profitable (Series: Paying Till It Hurts).
docs.snippet: Vaccination prices have risen significantly over the past 30 years, creating dilemmas for physicians and parents and straining public health budgets.

docs.lead_paragraph: The exchange, which has prided itself on being affordable, is facing requests for increases as high as 28 percent next year for some customers.

headline.main: Insurers on New York State’s Health Exchange Seek Significant Rate Increases
headline.print_headline: Plans in Health Exchange FaceRate Increases in 2015

docs.abstract: New York State residents are receiving notices from insurance companies saying they have asked for significant rate increases through state's health exchange for 2015; exchange, which has prided itself on being affordable, is facing increase requests as high as 28 percent for some customers of MetroPlus, one of least costly, and most popular, plans on exchange.
docs.snippet: The exchange, which has prided itself on being affordable, is facing requests for increases as high as 28 percent next year for some customers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite government moves to ease the path, a dense legal and bureaucratic thicket often awaits the survivor in a same-sex marriage, advocates say.

headline.seo: Same-Sex Couples Still Find Obstacles in Securing Benefits
headline.main: Gay, Widowed and Fighting for What They’re Due
headline.print_headline: Gay, Widowed and Fighting for the Benefits They’re Due

docs.abstract: Advocates for gays say that despite government moves to ease the path, a dense legal and bureaucratic thicket in both government and private sector often awaits the survivor in a same-sex marriage fighting for benefits they are due.
